SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 17: Strengthen the means of implementation and revitalize the Global Partnership for Sustainable Development
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 17.18: By 2020, enhance capacity-building support to developing countries, including for least developed countries and small island developing States, to increase significantly the availability of high-quality, timely and reliable data disaggregated by income, gender, age, race, ethnicity, migratory status, disability, geographic location and other characteristics relevant in national contexts
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 17.18.3: Number of countries with a national statistical plan that is fully funded and under implementation, by source of funding
SDG_SERIES_DESCR__GLOBAL:
SG_STT_NSDSFDDNR - Countries with national statistical plans with funding from donors (1 = YES; 0 = NO) [17.18.3]

SG_STT_NSDSFDGVT - Countries with national statistical plans with funding from Government (1 = YES; 0 = NO) [17.18.3]

SG_STT_NSDSFDOTHR - Countries with national statistical plans with funding from others (1 = YES; 0 = NO) [17.18.3]

SG_STT_NSDSFND - Countries with national statistical plans that are fully funded (1 = YES; 0 = NO) [17.18.3]

SG_STT_NSDSIMPL - Countries with national statistical plans that are under implementation (1 = YES; 0 = NO) [17.18.3]
SDG_RELATED_INDICATORS__GLOBAL: 17.19.1: Dollar value of all resources made available to strengthen statistical capacity in developing countries
SDG_CUSTODIAN_AGENCIES__GLOBAL: Partnership in Statistics for Development in the 21st Century (PARIS21)
CONTACT_ORGANISATION__GLOBAL: Partnership in Statistics for Development in the 21st Century (PARIS21)
STAT_CONC_DEF__GLOBAL:
Definition:

The indicator Number of countries with a national statistical plan that is fully funded and under implementation is based on the annual Status Report on National Strategies for the Development of Statistics (NSDS). In collaboration with its partners, PARIS21 reports on country progress in designing and implementing national statistical plans. The indicator is a count of countries that are either (i) implementing a strategy, (ii) designing one or (iii) awaiting adoption of the strategy in the current year.
SRC_TYPE_COLL_METHOD__GLOBAL:
3.a. Data sources (SOURCE_TYPE).

Partnership in Statistics for Development in the 21st Century (PARIS21) SDG Survey (Send questionnaire(s) to country)

Joint survey/compilation with national agency and international entity.

Data obtained directly from country database/website, collected through PARIS21’s engagement with countries through its workstream on NSDS (National Strategy for Development of Statistics), or PARIS21’s annual update on the status of National Strategies for the Development of Statistics (NSDS) (https://statisticalcapacitymonitor.org/indicator/165). Data collected through this source are prefilled in questionnaire and verified by countries through the PARIS21 SDG survey.

Coverage: All countries

List:

National Statistical Offices
COLL_METHOD__GLOBAL: Online survey and direct reporting from countries
COMPILING_ORG__GLOBAL: Partnership in Statistics for Development in the 21st Century (PARIS21)
RATIONALE__GLOBAL: If a country’s national statistical plan is fully funded, the plan is considered to be under implementation.
DATA_COMP__GLOBAL: Simple count of countries that are either (i) implementing a strategy, (ii) designing one or (iii) awaiting adoption of the strategy in the current year.
IMPUTATION__GLOBAL:
• At country level

No treatment of missing values at country level.

• At regional and global levels

No treatment of missing values at country level.
REG_AGG__GLOBAL: Regional-level aggregates are based on the total count of national strategies.
DOC_METHOD__GLOBAL:
Partnership in Statistics for Development in the 21st Century (PARIS21) SDG Survey through online form + PARIS21’s annual update on the status of National Strategies for the Development of Statistics (NSDS) (https://statisticalcapacitymonitor.org/indicator/165).

NSDS Guideline (https://nsdsguidelines.paris21.org/ )
QUALITY_ASSURE__GLOBAL:
• Practices and guidelines for quality assurance followed at the compiling agency.

Consultation with countries to check information available online.

• Consultation process with countries on the national data submitted to the SDGs Indicators Database.

Consultation through phone calls and emails.
COVERAGE__GLOBAL:
Data availability:

All countries and territories on the M49 list (https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/) with SDG focal points were surveyed. Data are available for 193 countries and territories in 2023.

Time series:

Available from 2019.

Disaggregation:

The indicator can be disaggregated by geographical area.
OTHER_DOC__GLOBAL:
URL: https://nsdsguidelines.paris21.org/

References: Guidelines for National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS)
